Concourse 2018 Year in Review

Dec 12, 2018

2018 has been an action-packed year for us. We saw a major release (Concourse 4.0.0) with a lot of new features: new auth connectors and users, dashboard, distributed GC and other runtime improvements. At the same time our team grew from 3 engineering pairs at the start of 2018 to 8 engineering pairs and an additional PM (ðŸ‘‹ Scott Foerster) working on Concourse OSS and supporting Concourse for PCF.

By theÂ Numbers

  • 13 releases of Concourse
  • 1 TLD snafu leading toour domain change
  • 1 new website design
  • 2 new ways to contact us (Discord, Discuss)
  • 1,070 members on Concourse Discord, 45 members in #contributors
  • 937 new GitHub issues created in 2018. Given th at only 1,694 issues were opened prior to 2018, Iâ€™d say thatâ€™s a pretty big jump in activity!
  • 417 PRs, up by 15% from last year
  • 3,300 stars, up by 38% from last year
